lines.text:
[to complain about the noise]
The woman over you is complaining.

[sarcastically]
Well, tell her I'll be right up.

[Off camera]
A penny for your thoughts.
[after a pause and then close-up]
A penny for your thoughts.

[Pensively]
A million dollars couldn't buy them.

[to an injured Jim coming off the train]
Well, you're looking fine, Jim... considering.

[Bitterly]
Considering what didn't get broken, got bent, eh!
Oh, if I were only a man!

[Suggestively]
The job wouldn't be nearly as interesting, not nearly.
A fella who flies for a living - what right does he have to get married?
Oh, if I were only a man!

[Suggestively]
The job wouldn't be nearly as interesting... not nearly.

[noticing her cumbersome trailing parachute]
Can I carry your train for you, your highness/
Don't you know an exhibition parachute when you see one?
Well, I was so interested in the exhibition...
[moving his eyes from the chute to her derrière]
... I never noticed the chute.

[Referring to song on the jukebox]
Remember that song? The birds do it... the bees do it...

[Cynically]
Yeah, and ducks do it, but who wants to be a duck?
[last lines]

[as Jim flies off]
there goes one of the greatest flyers that ever stepped behind the stick!
Yeah, and the greatest gut that ever lived!
